title: 115_hr3961
content: The Act is titled the "Kissimmee River Wild and Scenic River Study Act of 2018". It includes findings related to the study. The Kissimmee River restoration project, spanning 105 miles from Orlando to Lake Okeechobee, is the largest river restoration effort globally. It has enhanced 63,000 acres of wetlands, benefiting fish, wildlife, and wetland plants. Expected completion is in 2020. The Kissimmee River Restoration Project, spanning 105 miles from Orlando to Lake Okeechobee, is the largest global river restoration effort. Expected to be completed in 2020, it aims to reestablish historic hydrologic conditions, floodplain connectivity, wetland plant communities, and biological diversity. A study should be conducted post-completion to consider including the fully restored Kissimmee River in the National Wild and Scenic River program for preservation and enjoyment by future generations. The fully restored Kissimmee River could be included in the National Wild and Scenic River program as a tribute to the Army Corps of Engineers and the South Florida Water Management District's restoration efforts. SEC. 3. DESIGNATION FOR STUDY. Designation for Potential Addition of the Kissimmee River, Florida to the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act, including a study to be completed by the Secretary of the Interior within 3 years. The report required for the potential addition of the Kissimmee River, Florida to the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act must include a discussion on the impact of the designation on existing commercial and recreational activities such as cattle ranching, dairy production, hunting, fishing, trapping, recreational shooting, motor boat use, and bridge construction. The curr_chunk discusses the authority of State and local governments to manage activities related to energy production and military operations. It also mentions the Secretary of the Interior's influence on local land use decisions and restrictions on non-Federal land. The curr_chunk discusses restrictions on non-Federal land if designated under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act, including the Secretary of the Interior's authority to condemn property. It also mentions noninterference with the Kissimmee River Restoration Project. The Act prohibits interference with the Kissimmee River Restoration Project and ensures no negative impact on agricultural production in the area. It also specifies that the Act shall not affect the current management of the Kissimmee River area under the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act. The House of Representatives passed a bill related to the Kissimmee River Restoration Project, awaiting action from Congress.
